trans-unit.source: StorSimple 8000 Series Update 0.3 release notes - February 2015 | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: StorSimple 8000 Series Update 0.3 release notes - February 2015 | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Describes the new features, issues, and workarounds for the February 2015 StorSimple release.
trans-unit.target: Describes the new features, issues, and workarounds for the February 2015 StorSimple release.

trans-unit.source: The following release notes identify the critical open issues for StorSimple 8000 Series Update 0.3 released in February 2015.
trans-unit.target: The following release notes identify the critical open issues for StorSimple 8000 Series Update 0.3 released in February 2015.

trans-unit.source: They also contain a list of the StorSimple software and firmware updates included in this release.
trans-unit.target: They also contain a list of the StorSimple software and firmware updates included in this release.

trans-unit.source: This is the third release after the StorSimple 8000 Series Release version was made generally available in July 2014.
trans-unit.target: This is the third release after the StorSimple 8000 Series Release version was made generally available in July 2014.

trans-unit.source: This update does not change the device software version from the January update.
trans-unit.target: This update does not change the device software version from the January update.

trans-unit.source: It continues to be version 6.3.9600.17312.
trans-unit.target: It continues to be version 6.3.9600.17312.

trans-unit.source: You can confirm that the update has been installed by checking the Last Updated date.
trans-unit.target: You can confirm that the update has been installed by checking the Last Updated date.

trans-unit.source: If the date is 2/10/2015 or later, then the update has been installed successfully.
trans-unit.target: If the date is 2/10/2015 or later, then the update has been installed successfully.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you scan for and apply any available updates immediately after you install your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you scan for and apply any available updates immediately after you install your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: You can also turn on automatic updates to download and install high-priority updates from Microsoft as soon as they are released.
trans-unit.target: You can also turn on automatic updates to download and install high-priority updates from Microsoft as soon as they are released.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Update your StorSimple device</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Update your StorSimple device</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Please review the information contained in the release notes before you deploy the update in your StorSimple solution.
trans-unit.target: Please review the information contained in the release notes before you deploy the update in your StorSimple solution.

trans-unit.source: Use the StorSimple Manager service and not Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to install the February update.
trans-unit.target: Use the StorSimple Manager service and not Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to install the February update.

trans-unit.source: It takes approximately an hour to install this update.
trans-unit.target: It takes approximately an hour to install this update.

trans-unit.source: However, if you are installing cumulative updates, the process can take about 3 hours to complete.
trans-unit.target: However, if you are installing cumulative updates, the process can take about 3 hours to complete.

trans-unit.source: The February release of StorSimple does not contain any updates to the StorSimple virtual device.
trans-unit.target: The February release of StorSimple does not contain any updates to the StorSimple virtual device.

trans-unit.source: You can still apply any available Windows updates to the virtual device, including recent security fixes, but you will not see a change in version for the virtual device.
trans-unit.target: You can still apply any available Windows updates to the virtual device, including recent security fixes, but you will not see a change in version for the virtual device.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the following prerequisites are met prior to updating your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the following prerequisites are met prior to updating your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that both device controllers are running before you scan for updates.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that both device controllers are running before you scan for updates.

trans-unit.source: If either controller is not running, the scan will fail.
trans-unit.target: If either controller is not running, the scan will fail.

trans-unit.source: To verify that the controllers are in a healthy state, navigate to Hardware Status under the Maintenance page.
trans-unit.target: To verify that the controllers are in a healthy state, navigate to Hardware Status under the Maintenance page.

trans-unit.source: If there are components that Need attention, contact Microsoft Support before proceeding any further.
trans-unit.target: If there are components that Need attention, contact Microsoft Support before proceeding any further.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that fixed IPs for both controller 0 and controller 1 are routable and can connect to the Internet as these are used for servicing the updates to the device.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that fixed IPs for both controller 0 and controller 1 are routable and can connect to the Internet as these are used for servicing the updates to the device.

trans-unit.source: You can use the <linkText>Test-Connection cmdlet</linkText><title></title> to ping a known address outside of the network, such as outlook.com, to verify that the controller has connectivity to the outside network.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <linkText>Test-Connection cmdlet</linkText><title></title> to ping a known address outside of the network, such as outlook.com, to verify that the controller has connectivity to the outside network.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that ports 80 and 443 are available on your StorSimple device for outbound communication.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that ports 80 and 443 are available on your StorSimple device for outbound communication.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the <linkText>Networking requirements for your StorSimple device</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the <linkText>Networking requirements for your StorSimple device</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If the device software version is older than 6.3.9600.17312 (October 2014 update), disable the Data 2 and Data 3 ports, if enabled, before starting the update.
trans-unit.target: If the device software version is older than 6.3.9600.17312 (October 2014 update), disable the Data 2 and Data 3 ports, if enabled, before starting the update.

trans-unit.source: Leaving the Data 2 or Data 3 ports enabled when you apply the update might cause your device controller to go into recovery mode.
trans-unit.target: Leaving the Data 2 or Data 3 ports enabled when you apply the update might cause your device controller to go into recovery mode.

trans-unit.source: Please note that when you disable the network interfaces, all the associated volumes will be taken offline and the I/Os will be disrupted for the duration of the update.
trans-unit.target: Please note that when you disable the network interfaces, all the associated volumes will be taken offline and the I/Os will be disrupted for the duration of the update.

trans-unit.source: This update contains a fix for the factory reset issue that occurred on devices that had been upgraded from the GA release to the October 2014 release.
trans-unit.target: This update contains a fix for the factory reset issue that occurred on devices that had been upgraded from the GA release to the October 2014 release.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Issues fixed in this release</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Issues fixed in this release</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This update does not contain new features or functionality.
trans-unit.target: This update does not contain new features or functionality.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the issue that was fixed in this update.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the issue that was fixed in this update.

trans-unit.source: No.
trans-unit.target: No.

trans-unit.source: Feature
trans-unit.target: Feature

trans-unit.source: Issue
trans-unit.target: Issue

trans-unit.source: Applies to physical device
trans-unit.target: Applies to physical device

trans-unit.source: Applies to virtual device
trans-unit.target: Applies to virtual device

trans-unit.source: Factory reset
trans-unit.target: Factory reset

trans-unit.source: You try to perform a factory reset on a device that originally had the GA release (version 6.3.9600.17215) installed but has been updated to the October release (version 6.3.9600.17312).
trans-unit.target: You try to perform a factory reset on a device that originally had the GA release (version 6.3.9600.17215) installed but has been updated to the October release (version 6.3.9600.17312).

trans-unit.source: The factory reset fails and the device becomes unstable.
trans-unit.target: The factory reset fails and the device becomes unstable.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: The following table provides a summary of known issues in this release.
trans-unit.target: The following table provides a summary of known issues in this release.

trans-unit.source: No.
trans-unit.target: No.

trans-unit.source: Feature
trans-unit.target: Feature

trans-unit.source: Issue
trans-unit.target: Issue

trans-unit.source: Comments/workaround
trans-unit.target: Comments/workaround

trans-unit.source: Applies to physical device
trans-unit.target: Applies to physical device

trans-unit.source: Applies to virtual device
trans-unit.target: Applies to virtual device

trans-unit.source: Factory reset
trans-unit.target: Factory reset

trans-unit.source: In some instances, when you perform a factory reset, the StorSimple device may be stuck and display this message: Reset to factory is in progress (phase 8).
trans-unit.target: In some instances, when you perform a factory reset, the StorSimple device may be stuck and display this message: Reset to factory is in progress (phase 8).

trans-unit.source: This happens if you press CTRL+C while the cmdlet is in progress.
trans-unit.target: This happens if you press CTRL+C while the cmdlet is in progress.

trans-unit.source: Do not press CTRL+C after initiating a factory reset.
trans-unit.target: Do not press CTRL+C after initiating a factory reset.

trans-unit.source: If you are already in this state, please contact Microsoft Support for next steps.
trans-unit.target: If you are already in this state, please contact Microsoft Support for next steps.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Disk quorum
trans-unit.target: Disk quorum

trans-unit.source: In rare instances, if the majority of disks in the EBOD enclosure of an 8600device are disconnected resulting in no disk quorum, then the storage pool will be offline.
trans-unit.target: In rare instances, if the majority of disks in the EBOD enclosure of an 8600device are disconnected resulting in no disk quorum, then the storage pool will be offline.

trans-unit.source: It will stay offline even if the disks are reconnected.
trans-unit.target: It will stay offline even if the disks are reconnected.

trans-unit.source: You will need to reboot the device.
trans-unit.target: You will need to reboot the device.

trans-unit.source: If the issue persists, please contact Microsoft Support for next steps.
trans-unit.target: If the issue persists, please contact Microsoft Support for next steps.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Cloud snapshot failures
trans-unit.target: Cloud snapshot failures

trans-unit.source: In rare instances, a cloud snapshot may fail with the error Maximum backup limit reached.
trans-unit.target: In rare instances, a cloud snapshot may fail with the error Maximum backup limit reached.

trans-unit.source: This occurs if you exceed 255 online clones on the same device, from the same original volume which has been deleted.
trans-unit.target: This occurs if you exceed 255 online clones on the same device, from the same original volume which has been deleted.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: Incorrect controller ID
trans-unit.target: Incorrect controller ID

trans-unit.source: When a controller replacement is performed, controller 0 may show up as controller 1.
trans-unit.target: When a controller replacement is performed, controller 0 may show up as controller 1.

trans-unit.source: During controller replacement, when the image is loaded from the peer node, the controller ID can show up initially as the peer controller’s ID.
trans-unit.target: During controller replacement, when the image is loaded from the peer node, the controller ID can show up initially as the peer controller’s ID.

trans-unit.source: In rare instances, this behavior may also be seen after a system reboot.
trans-unit.target: In rare instances, this behavior may also be seen after a system reboot.

trans-unit.source: No user action is required.
trans-unit.target: No user action is required.

trans-unit.source: This situation will resolve itself after the controller replacement is complete.
trans-unit.target: This situation will resolve itself after the controller replacement is complete.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Device monitoring charts
trans-unit.target: Device monitoring charts

trans-unit.source: In the StorSimple Manager service, the device monitoring charts do not work when Basic or NTLM authentication is enabled in the proxy server configuration for the device.
trans-unit.target: In the StorSimple Manager service, the device monitoring charts do not work when Basic or NTLM authentication is enabled in the proxy server configuration for the device.

trans-unit.source: Modify the web proxy configuration for the device registered with your StorSimple Manager service so that authentication is set to NONE.
trans-unit.target: Modify the web proxy configuration for the device registered with your StorSimple Manager service so that authentication is set to NONE.

trans-unit.source: To do this, run the the Windows PowerShell for StorSimple Set-HcsWebProxy cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To do this, run the the Windows PowerShell for StorSimple Set-HcsWebProxy cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: Storage accounts
trans-unit.target: Storage accounts

trans-unit.source: Using the Storage service to delete the storage account is an unsupported scenario.
trans-unit.target: Using the Storage service to delete the storage account is an unsupported scenario.

trans-unit.source: This will lead to a situation in which user data cannot be retrieved.
trans-unit.target: This will lead to a situation in which user data cannot be retrieved.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: Device failover
trans-unit.target: Device failover

trans-unit.source: Multiple failovers of a volume container from the same source device to different target devices is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Multiple failovers of a volume container from the same source device to different target devices is not supported.

trans-unit.source: Failover from a single dead device to multiple devices will make the volume containers on the first failed over device lose data ownership.
trans-unit.target: Failover from a single dead device to multiple devices will make the volume containers on the first failed over device lose data ownership.

trans-unit.source: After such a failover, these volume containers will appear or behave differently when you view them in the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: After such a failover, these volume containers will appear or behave differently when you view them in the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Installation
trans-unit.target: Installation

trans-unit.source: During StorSimple Adapter for SharePoint installation, you need to provide a device IP in order for the install to finish successfully.
trans-unit.target: During StorSimple Adapter for SharePoint installation, you need to provide a device IP in order for the install to finish successfully.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Web proxy
trans-unit.target: Web proxy

trans-unit.source: If your web proxy configuration has HTTPS as the specified protocol, then your device-to-service communication will be affected and the device will go offline.
trans-unit.target: If your web proxy configuration has HTTPS as the specified protocol, then your device-to-service communication will be affected and the device will go offline.

trans-unit.source: Support packages will also be generated in the process, consuming significant resources on your device.
trans-unit.target: Support packages will also be generated in the process, consuming significant resources on your device.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the web proxy URL has HTTP as the specified protocol.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the web proxy URL has HTTP as the specified protocol.

trans-unit.source: More information on how to <linkText>Configure web proxy for your device</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: More information on how to <linkText>Configure web proxy for your device</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Web proxy
trans-unit.target: Web proxy

trans-unit.source: If you configure and enable web proxy on a registered device, then you will need to restart the active controller on your device.
trans-unit.target: If you configure and enable web proxy on a registered device, then you will need to restart the active controller on your device.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: High cloud latency and high I/O workload
trans-unit.target: High cloud latency and high I/O workload

trans-unit.source: When your StorSimple device encounters a combination of very high cloud latencies (order of seconds) and high I/O workload, the device volumes go into a degraded state and the I/Os may fail with a "device not ready" error.
trans-unit.target: When your StorSimple device encounters a combination of very high cloud latencies (order of seconds) and high I/O workload, the device volumes go into a degraded state and the I/Os may fail with a "device not ready" error.

trans-unit.source: You will need to manually reboot the device controllers or perform a device failover to recover from this situation.
trans-unit.target: You will need to manually reboot the device controllers or perform a device failover to recover from this situation.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: This update fixes the factory reset issue that occurred on devices that had been upgraded from the GA release to the October 2014 release.
trans-unit.target: This update fixes the factory reset issue that occurred on devices that had been upgraded from the GA release to the October 2014 release.

trans-unit.source: It does not contain any other updates to the StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: It does not contain any other updates to the StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: This release does not contain any updates to the serial-attached SCSI (SAS) controller or the firmware.
trans-unit.target: This release does not contain any updates to the serial-attached SCSI (SAS) controller or the firmware.

trans-unit.source: The driver update was in the October, 2014 release.
trans-unit.target: The driver update was in the October, 2014 release.

trans-unit.source: This release does not contain any updates for the virtual device.
trans-unit.target: This release does not contain any updates for the virtual device.

trans-unit.source: Applying this update will not change the software version of a virtual device.
trans-unit.target: Applying this update will not change the software version of a virtual device.
